Speaker: lanky
Dialogue: Why did it have to be these caves...

Speaker: lanky
Dialogue: Don't mind me, buddy. It's nothin'.

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: Last winter, a man kidnapped a little girl and holed up in one of these caves. The cops had him pinned down and began to move in. This guy started shooting... but he wasn't aiming at the officers...  ...he was firing at something inside.

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: When the dust cleared, all they found was the little girl's shoes.  With the feet still in 'em.

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: Hey, relax, I nearly shit myself when my boss pulled that one on me.

Speaker: mean green
Dialogue: Stop it right there! You will not rape Mother Nature one more day!

Speaker: hippie group
Dialogue: Mother Nature is not a whore/Don't dump in her any-more/Mother Nature is not a whore/Don't dump in her any- more...

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: Take it easy! We have a permit!

Speaker: mean green
Dialogue: And we have an injunction from the State to prevent any dumping in these caverns! This is virgin land! The aqueducts in these caves bring drinking water to our families, and its piping provides drainage for our farms that enrich this barren land! And it won't be tainted by waste of any kind! Not now! Not ever!

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: How do you guys always know where we're going?

Speaker: mean green
Dialogue: I'll tell ya next time! NOW MOVE IT!

Speaker: mean green
Dialogue: Score one for the green team!!!

Speaker: bearded cameraman
Dialogue: Hey, man, that was righteous, but I need a shot with the sign up.

Speaker: mean green
Dialogue: We saved you today, ol' gal.

Speaker: mean green
Dialogue: Sister, why do you always swing for the fences?

Speaker: fuzzy
Dialogue: It's okay, but I... I think I see something in there... something shiny.

Speaker: fuzzy
Dialogue: Oh my, it looks like diamonds!

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: They took my laptop with my PowerPoint presentation, my Blackberry, my cell... And to top it off, my car crapped out on the side of the road! I'm not making the conference and I have fourteen leads waiting for me. You gotta help me out here. I'm not kidding, I've have fourteen PRIMO leads waiting in the lobby of the Mariott... MARIOTT...

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: Son of a --  In with anger, out with love.

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: I mean, we'd been together for so long and then... bang! She drops me. Since then, it's been like a damn country song: she's gone, the car's repossessed, and a father figure made a pass at me. I'm not saying I ever had it. But I have definitely lost it.  Now I haul this swill from armpit to armpit. I used to be a model for Christ's sake.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: You know, Chach, catching you at this low point is pure serendipity.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: Because I take the rubble of man and build superstars. In my briefcase here is a doorway to a self-help sensation. Give me a minute, because I'd like to buy you a drink and change your life forever. I have a brochure --

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Save it. We don't deal in pamphlets 'round here. We stick to chemistry. And his drinks are on me.

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: Yup, one keg of Beast for the basement, then the truck's dry.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: If you're stayin', move the truck, boss gets pissed about you using primo parking.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: ...the search for the missing protesters will be further complicated by the unstable conditions of these deep tunnels. Thus far, no sign of life has been detected, yet town officials are still optimistic.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: On a brighter note, or should I say a darker note, tomorrow's solar eclipse will bring out adults and children alike for a citywide fair of this metrological event. Stay tuned for our man on the street to take a closer look...

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: He said there was no reason I had to stay a teller and that if I did good work and didn't mess up, I could become an assistant manager within three years.  Can you believe that?

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: That sounds like bullshit! I could be an assistant manager at The Lake Arrowhead Casino for knowing the fuckin' alphabet to G! I'll be twenty in three months...

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: If I could made that kind of money, I'd be in Hollywood next week.

Speaker: edgy cat
Dialogue: That cash is gonna look much better in my pocket.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Ya know, that deer only looks scared when you're in the room.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Ohhh, now that's a rough one.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Yoh anga will be yoh downfah. Go again?

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: How much for the whole night, Grandma?

Speaker: grandpa
Dialogue: This one will stun ya, but this one will put ya to sleep.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: You boys wanna try your luck at the loot?

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Come on, I'll even throw with my left hand.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Nothin' but a bunch of butts and pussies in here!

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Don't sweat it, just clean it up before he's done.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: I love a woman with enthusiasm.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: I got two hundred bucks says none of you can beat me!

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Hey! Get quiet or get out.

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: Unless you people want to die you'll do what I say and you'll do it fast!

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: You hold it right there, mister.

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: A storm of hell's coming down on this place any minute!

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: I'm not armed now, just hear me out.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: I'll drop you and not even think about it!

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: Take a good look and listen to me! There's at least a four of these things out there!

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: I saw one of them tear up five men like they were corn on the cob!  I don't know what they are. I don't know where they came from. All I do know is that these fuckers are fast, nasty, and hungry.

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: And they can fly. Not to mention they got claws like Ginsu knifes and more teeth than a chainsaw.

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: They're like goddamn blood hungry biker tattoos come to life. They're clocking us. Right now. And we have to lock this bar down!  That means doors, windows, drains, and basements. We have to do it fast!

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: You! Get on that phone. Call the cops, National Guard, townies, whoever kicks ass and get 'em out here.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: The jungle has a new king.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Is there a gun pointing at you?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Alright goddamn it! Who shot me!? Who did it!?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: My goddamn foot is gone! Who fuckin' shot me? Who fuckin' shot me!?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: What?  What the hell happened down here?!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: I didn't do it! It was fuckin' monsters, asshole!

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Jesus Christ on the cross... someone make sense.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Easy. We're surrounded by something the likes none of you have ever seen before. Some kind of animals. Real fast, volatile, predators. One went through three of your patrons like nothing.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: So, your dead hubby shot me twice, three of my customers have been eaten, and there are angry creatures outside?

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: He shot you the other time.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: That's one piece of four problems.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: That head over there, that's the oldest of the bunch, looked like the Grandpa. We caught the little one, Junior, in the cooler there. As we've seen, what he lacks in size he more than makes up for in speed.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Unfortunately, the worst of 'em are still outside.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: The next one is taller, but all out of proportion. Like a "teen beast."

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: I just took the eye out of the mother. She calculates, guiding the attacks.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: If you are face to face with her, dive left.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: And the last one is the --

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: No sign of any weaknesses. No sign at all. He's an eating machine.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: Of all the friggin' bars to be stuck in.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: That's not it. Four are here, but there's three others... which I can't account for.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: We need to lock this place down. Is everyone in this room?

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: Oh my god! My son! My SON!

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: Oh sweetheart! What was I thinking? Mommy is never gonna let you go!

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: Never, ever, never. Never, ever, never, baby. I love you --

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Just let her be... please.  Is that the only phone?

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: The back phone is wrecked, too.

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: This is really happening. I can't believe this is really happening.

Speaker: para
Dialogue: Thank you, but I don't need any help --

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: What's this? A power magnet or something?

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: I didn't peg you for a con man.

Speaker: para
Dialogue: Hey, it pays more than the couch.

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: Lots of stuff around here does.

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: So, what now? Did those things leave?

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Why don't you go check it out?

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: I have a signal! I have -- Diane? Diane listen to me... get the kids and get in the basement... do it right now...

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: I'll explain later. Not now! I'm at a bar... look... shut up! JUST SHUT UP AND GET IN THE FUCKING BASEMENT, DIANE! Diane! Diane?... Hello? Damn it! I lost the signal!

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: Okay. Okay. Look now, I gotta get outta here! I gotta go! My wife... See my wife is alone... She could be in trouble. I GOTTA GO!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: You can risk your life, but not mine! My daughter's no more than twenty miles from here waiting for me. I have just as much reason to leave this place as you do. But I also know that if they're here, then they're not there yet.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Now pull that tough boy shit again and I'll slice you from neck to nuts!

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: You can't keep me here. This is bullshit. Fuckin' bullshit. This is fucking BULLSHIT!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: We can't risk letting them in.

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: See! This has to be isolated. That's a local broadcast.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: And now, we head to our man on the scene with a live look at tomorrow's event in Red Mountain.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: Can you hear us? Apparently we're having some technical difficulties...

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: That's right, the crowds are lining up early to witness tomorrow's meteorological phenomenon.

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: But always remember, don't look straight into the sun because a special filter is needed to avoid damaging your cornea.

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: And we're all looking forward to it tomorrow. Back to you.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: Thank you. And in other news...

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: That studio's local, we can call in.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: I have a short wave radio upstairs.

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: Hello? Yes, we're at the United --

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: ...it has been reported that the power outage --

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Keep it together! I came from the east. That studio is south of here. For all we know, north and west are okay.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: An associate of mine was coming in from the north, ain't heard a word from him in hours.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: I've got some tools and extra planks in the kitchen, if we're on the same page here.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: We have to kill it.  Can you help?

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: Jesus, it took all that? All those bullets? How can we possibly fight off the others?

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Aim for their orifices. Eyes, ears and mouth. From what I've seen, it's their only weakness.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: Looks like they're soft on the inside like any other animal. Trick is to get in there and do the damage.

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: Maybe we don't have to fight them.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, if I may have your attention.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: We have to think outside the box here. We don't need to fight them, we need to scare them. Scare them right back. This is a species stand- off. We just need to show them we're not vulnerable. That we're formidable.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: Showing superiority. The scent of their dead may drive them away.

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: Is there a call, or something?

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: See that you monkey fucks! That's what you get when you mess with us! Woman or man, I don't give a fuck! Shit don't make me gay because you'll be sucking my dick!

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: It's working. I think it's working.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: You see? What I tell you?

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: We're stuck in here. That's what.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: If you don't mind me asking, how did you run into these things?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: More importantly, how did you run away from these things?

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Well, it all started about forty hours ago...

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: So, how is staying with Grandma working out? Ya know, if you stare into her glasses, you can see what cards she is holding. But I didn't tell you that.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Mommy will pick you up tomorrow night, okay baby?

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: We barricaded ourselves in the cellar. Then it was just listening. We heard those things destroy an entire heard of livestock. They just kept coming. Closer and closer, consuming anything in the way. Slashing, feeding and licking the bones clean. Just when we said our prayers, the first ray of sun hit the house...

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: That first beam of sunlight drove 'em away. Somewhere. We called who we could and then decided to run for it. We didn't see a soul the whole drive out. When the tank went dry, we came upon a gas station to refill.

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: What's goin' on? The pumps are off.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: We had no time. All we knew was the sun was dropping and we had to get enough fuel to make it through the night at 90 miles per hour...

Speaker: hero
Dialogue: Suck it down you metal bitch. Suck it down.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: That's when I saw three others... just for a second.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: It must have smelled the blood or something. We buried the body and got back on the main road when...

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: And that's how I ended up here.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: I don't want to talk about that.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: No. It was wild out there. No time to think. We just moved. He didn't leave me. He just ran.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: The three from the gas pump are over at the TV station? And you say there's four here, huh?

Speaker: para
Dialogue: Hey, you lived on a farm, right?

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: Do you think they're gone? I haven't heard anything for a while, maybe they're gone.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: As long as it's dark, they're around. They hide, wait for you to drop your guard, and then attack.

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: How can you be so sure? You said yourself this started a day ago.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: We? We learned fast? You are all that is left of we. No offense Pocohantas, but I think someone else should play "Chief" tonight. Someone that knows the lay of the land.  Like me.

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: Maybe these things are like locusts or something and only come out for a few days to feed. This could just be a part of their life cycle.

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: Somebody's gotta know something about these things. This stuff just doesn't happen out of the blue.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: You gotta know somethin', you're old.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Old people know stuff like this. Legends, tall tales, shit like that.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: How 'bout you? Or do I have to get rough?

Speaker: grandpa
Dialogue: If I throw a stick, will you go away?

Speaker: para
Dialogue: Did you ever slaughter? Slaughter livestock?

Speaker: para
Dialogue: Slaughterhouse run-off used to be drained into piping that ran through the mountains.

Speaker: para
Dialogue: Earthquakes often cracked the piping and those flow lines were condemned, but never drained.

Speaker: para
Dialogue: What I am saying is... there's a distinct possibility that what we are up against is the result of steady stream of blood and tissue that has been leaking into the caves. And a day ago... something broke out.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: The first order of business is gettin' a big fuckin' tampon in that cave!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: They're probably on to the next buffet by now. There's a retirement home up the road, they'd be easy pickings.

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: I'm telling you, I don't see a thing --

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Everyone stay in the middle of the room! Off the walls! NOW!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Now, does everyone agree that they are still out there?

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: I know some first aid if we have a kit. Do we?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: In the kitchen, under the sink.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: No one goes anywhere alone. Least of all, unarmed.

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: There's some sweats in my bag behind the bar.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: You're a clever man.  Why do you take shit from him?

Speaker: para
Dialogue: Yeah, he's an ass, but he's my brother. Que sera-sera.

Speaker: para
Dialogue: Look man, I read books. He reads bumper stickers.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Alright, we need to stay alert and for everyone to take a role.  You gotta have some guns or weapons around here.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: I got my .38 here. That's six shots and two refills. Downstairs, I have locker with a sawed-off and some gardening tools. Maybe a few boxes of shells.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: I got shells, too. Box and a half tops. Machete behind the bar.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: So we've got guns, kitchen knives, pipes, fire and sticks.

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: I might be able to do something with the bottles.

Speaker: grandpa
Dialogue: You're gonna need a whole lot more than that to get outta here alive.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Oh, now you have something to say?

Speaker: grandpa
Dialogue: You young'uns worry about weapons, I'm thinkin' 'bout strategy.

Speaker: grandpa
Dialogue: Sit still, look less like a meal.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: That's for bears and sharks, chunky chew.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Alright, what else do we have? Can we somehow contact the outside world?

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: I can't get anybody. I don't even know if I have a signal anymore.

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: I have a CB in my truck, we could get some help out here.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Who the hell would you call?

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Do you drive a short beer bus or something? You go out there, you get eaten. You stay in here, you get eaten. Anyone comes to help, they get eaten. Don't you see a pattern here, Spuds Makenzie?

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: Then I guess we should just give up.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Believe me, I'd love to save the day and get some heroic snatch, but it's not in the cards, partner.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: You said you had a short wave radio.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Go for it. It's by the far wall. Channel 9 is the emergency frequency.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Good. I'm heading to the basement for supplies.  And you're going upstairs.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: So that's how it is?  Fine! Shotgun, please.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: You're coming with, portly. 'Cause if I'm attacked, I want a fat man close by.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: What are you gonna do? Throw your teeth at 'em? Sit down, Cocoon.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: You! Zorba! You're coming too!  Now gimme the keys.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Those two will be on the other side waiting for you. If you become food, I don't want the only set of keys in the belly of one of those things.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Any volunteers to head into the basement with me?

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: Shut up! Shut your mouth. You have no idea what is running through me right now. No idea.  I'm ready.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Alright you two, I don't want to hear any of this, "oh, I dropped the key, wrong key, ain't no key here." When I want out, I want out, ok?

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Come on. Come on. Come on.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Geeezzzus.  Okay, now. Easy steps. Easy breaths. Easy steps.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Morphine. My magic potion. I need a few drops.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: You should try a little, it'll calm your nerves. Works like a charm.

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: No other time than now, right?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Wait, before you do that, help me move. There's a small room off the kitchen where I can lay down.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: It's much safer in there. Trust me.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: You don't need to know what that is.

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: There's a sawed-off shotgun in here.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Just a bat! I'm okay! Just a bat!

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: I can't feel a thing, Hon.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: You're a bad girl, aren't you.

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: Trust me, I plan on having a full breakdown when this is over, but for now, we all have to be strong, right?

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: This is my daughter, Charlie. She's all I'm after.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: And I'm gonna need your strength, every bit of it.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Good. But still do me a favor.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Don't tell anyone I have a soft side.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Hello? Anyone there? We need help out here at the United Nations Tavern. Send guns, tanks, and all that shit.

Speaker: belle
Dialogue: How much you got to see the show?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: You don't understand, sweety. Daddy doesn't pay. Daddy sees the show for free. But you do get points for being horny on a night like this.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: You can't expect a man to buy a car without a test drive first, can you?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Now wiggle that sweet little ass over here and sit on Daddy's face, I wanna do some appraising.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Repeat. We need help. SOS. Calling all cars! Calling all cars! We need help at the United Nations Tav --

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: Great god, why do you damn me?!

Speaker: para
Dialogue: I thought that was it for a second there.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: I got Papa in the stones.  He's neutered.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: That back room is sealed shut.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: I told you to stay in the main room.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Yeah... I will. I will. Promise.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: If they can't reproduce anymore -- we are one step closer! A big step! Now is the time to band together. We need to rise up against these monsters of the night! Those creatures are no match for the human spirit! We can do it! We just need to believe in each other! In all of us! We need to make a stand! Right here! Right now!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: We know what not to do. We must stay focused and together. The beasts will find a breach. We gotta find a way out before they find a way in.

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: Let's run for the cars, cause mass confusion.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: The lot's too damn far, that's surefire suicide.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: You. What was that door downstairs?

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: It runs about a hundred yards and spits out on the backside of that hill down the way.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: Grass, man. I grow pot down there.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Does the tunnel spit out near a car?

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: It spits out behind the parking lot.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: My truck is near, but it ain't nearly big enough to haul the whole lot.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: It's a shot. Is it gassed up?

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Three of us go. Two to defend, one to drive. We back up to the bar and then tear ass out of here.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Let me make this clear; if we stay, we die.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: You're trusting that con? He'll ditch us and never look back.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Hey! I'm not trusting him either, that's why I'm going with.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: "Courage is being scared to death, but saddling up anyway."  The Duke. I will go.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: This is it. They have this place surrounded, but if we go under them we might just make it.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: This is a bottleneck waiting to happen.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: This one's great under pressure. I wish you luck.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: The rest of you prepare the weapons, whatever you got left. 'Cause when we crash through those walls, we're bringin' death with us.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: No, I don't believe in guns.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: This ain't time for a political stance.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: This doesn't run out of ammo.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: When you get to that truck... drive it like you stole it.

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: It serves you right for cheating.

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: I figure it's karma. You wronged me and you wronged your wife, so this is karma biting you on the ass, or in your case... in the eye.

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: It could be worse, you could be dead. Then again, the climax is upon us.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Ya know, that's not a bad look on you. Kinda 1985, but not bad. I'd hook it up.

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: I wouldn't fuck you for practice.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Hey, cyclops. Let's have a quiet contest... starting now.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Ya know, in situations of duress, I have found that women are attracted to my authority.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: You handle yourself pretty well. You a cop or a criminal?

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: Oh yeah? Then how do you do it?

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: I just think about my husband and daughter... and the rest is easy.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: This place is creepy in the daytime, too. Ready?

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: Of course not. I fight monsters all the time.  On three.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: Looks like a brothel for plants.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Ah-ah-ah! You're doing that all wrong!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: I know you're doing it wrong.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: You and I are similar. We both have accents. We both travel a lot. We both don't really have homes...

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: I am sorry, I ramble when I'm nervous.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: It's just that this seems like the opportune time for someone to be horribly... offed.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: You don't want the rag touching booze, that way you can hold it and ensure it explodes when you throw it.

Speaker: para
Dialogue: You sure? I thought the rag had to touch?

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Perfecto. What we should do, though, is put those peanut barrels to use. Fill 'em with booze and line up some planks. If the walls come down... we hit 'em Donkey Kong style.

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: You aren't nearly as dumb as you look, are you?

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Next time, look within. Stereotyping can be ugly and hurtful.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Excuse me for being forward, but I'm curious about your dimensions.

Speaker: roadie
Dialogue: They're trying to burrow through the tunnel walls.

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: Grab onto ceiling and get out of water!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: You fuck with my family.  I fuck right back!

Speaker: coach
Dialogue: They will write stories of your bravery.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Send it up! Send it up!

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: Hey! Hey! She's in the shaft!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Move it! Move it! Move it!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Ol' Crazy Horse has seen it.

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: What the fuck are you doing?!

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: They can't get in here! We agreed! They'll get us!

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: I will not die because of her!

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Don't be stupid, drop the gun!

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: They'll get in! We'll all die!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Stop trying to get people killed. It is getting very old.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Let's prepare ourselves, they ought to be here with the truck any minute.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: If you ask me, I'm gonna just lay right here, wait for sunrise, then walk on out of here.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: That's your choice, but this is going to get a whole lot worse before it gets any better.

Speaker: boss man
Dialogue: If all of you run for it, they won't care about lil ol' me. They like the food that moves...

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Get on the tables!!! On the tables!!!

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Just watch the floor and keep the others safe!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: I need to get your number.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Come and get me you blood-chugging CUNT!

Speaker: trampy
Dialogue: You got her? You got her!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Not for long, we gotta burn it.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: Come on! Let's blow this thing!

Speaker: beer guy
Dialogue: When this lights, run like hell.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: The fan has officially been buried in the shit.

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: I meant to tell you so much!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Lord, if I die, bury me upside down so the world can KISS MY ASS!

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: I think we're in the clear --

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: Are you two all right? They left! We made it! I think we made it!

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: We're safe until dark, but we need to find other people.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: You know where the IGA grocery store is over in Red Mountain?

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: I don't wanna go home alone... I don't wanna see what might have...

Speaker: tuffy
Dialogue: Don't worry about that. Just go.

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: I'm sorry about your son. I really am.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: We're going to get my little girl.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: It's right up there, in the back of the store.

Speaker: adulterer
Dialogue: I don't know, I just got here. Did you find your girl?

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: She's supposed to already be here.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: This place is a ghost town.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: Twenty miles. Red Mountain, surrounding farms, local TV studio.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: We'll have figures within the hour.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: This is the California high desert.

Speaker: heroine
Dialogue: You're not safe, she's still alive, she'll be back...

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Get these cuffs off me! I'm a goddamn hero for Christ's sake!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: Thanks for waitin' for me back there, really fuckin' appreciate it!

Speaker: bozo
Dialogue: I found a new weak spot on 'em, but it damn ain't pretty getting to it.
